body.p:
Hd. Qrs. Dept. of the Ohio
Cin. O. Oct. 6th 1862.
Sir,

I am directed by the General Commanding to say, in reply to your letter of Oct. 3d, that he has no control over paroled prisoners: they come under charge of the Commissary Genl of prisoners, at Detroit, Mich.

Camp Chase is the appointed rendezvous, for all paroled prisoners, belonging to regiments from Kentucky, (see Genl Order, War Dept. No 72.1862) and the establishment of such a camp as you propose, near Louisville, is not in his power.

Very Respectfully,
Your Obdt Sert.
T. L. Hayden A. D. C.

Hon J. F. Robinson
Gov. of Kentucky

Prisoners &c
From Genl. Wright
Cincinnati
No Ans required
